title: Space Command: U.S. satellites ‘constrained’ by lack of mobility
summary: Lt. Gen. Shaw said a key concern is that U.S. surveillance satellites that monitor potentially hostile activities are at disadvantage because of their limited maneuverability

title: SpaceX completes fueling test, will now work toward massive engine firing test
summary: SpaceX said it loaded more than 10 million pounds of fuel onto the vehicle.

title: Space Force not buying large satellites for the foreseeable future
summary: The era of massive satellites needs to be in the rear view mirror for the Department of Defense, the head of military space acquisitions Frank Calvelli said Jan. 24.

title: NASA and DARPA to partner on nuclear thermal propulsion demonstration
summary: NASA and DARPA will cooperate on the development and flight demonstration of a nuclear propulsion system with applications for both national security and space exploration.

title: Buckle up, it could get bumpy: The space economy’s vaunted resilience will be tested in 2023
summary: While challenging economic conditions this year will hit some space companies harder than others, the industry as a whole is expected to remain robust as multiple headwinds rock the sector.
